snippet: Strong television advertising and growth in digital products helped offset the decline in newspaper advertising at Gannett, the publisher of USA Today.
abstract: Gannett Co reports 25 percent decline in first-quarter profit as advertising in its newspapers continues to decline; earnings were $68.2 million, or 28 cents a share, down from $90.5 million, or 37 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue fell 2.6 percent to $1.22 billion from $1.25 billion.
lead_paragraph: Strong television advertising and growth in digital products helped offset the decline in newspaper advertising at Gannett, the publisher of USA Today.

headline.seo: Gannett Profit Falls 25% on Newspaper Ad Decline
